com.hannesdorfmann.mosby3

Class PresenterManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hannesdorfmann.mosby3.PresenterManager

  • public final class PresenterManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A internal class responsible to save internal presenter instances during screen orientation changes and reattach the presenter afterwards.

    The idea is that each MVP View (like a Activity, Fragment, ViewGroup) will get a unique view id. This view id is used to store the presenter and viewstate in it. After screen orientation changes we can reuse the presenter and viewstate by querying for the given view id (must be saved in view's state somehow).

    Since:
    3.0

      • getPresenter

        public static <P> P getPresenter(Activity activity,
                                 java.lang.String viewId)
        Get the presenter for the View with the given (Mosby - internal) view Id or null if no presenter for the given view (via view id) exists.
        Type Parameters:
        P - The Presenter type
        Parameters:
        activity - The Activity (used for scoping)
        viewId - The mosby internal View Id (unique among all MvpView
        Returns:
        The Presenter or null

      • remove

        public static void remove(Activity activity,
                          java.lang.String viewId)
        Removes the Presenter (and ViewState) for the given View. Does nothing if no Presenter is stored internally with the given viewId
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity
        viewId - The mosby internal view id
